name.text: Open Research Conversation: Open Research with the Wellcome Trust

description.text: Join us for an online discussion of the Wellcome Trust's new Open Access policy, with Hannah Hope from the Wellcome Trust
description.html: Join us for an online discussion of the Wellcome Trust's new Open Access policy, with Hannah Hope from the Wellcome Trust

node.summary: Join us for an online discussion of the Wellcome Trust's new Open Access policy, with Hannah Hope from the Wellcome Trust

description.text:
UKRI is currently consulting on the future development of its open access policy, including the inclusion of monographs, edited collections and book chapters into the policy scope. The changes under consultation will affect all UKRI funded researchers. Particular areas that may be of interest are: funding for open access books, licensing requirements and embargo periods.
We invite researchers at all levels (including PGRs) to discuss the consultation, ask questions and provide feedback at an online forum. The feedback you provide will shape our institutional response to UKRI. 
The forum will be held via Blackboard Collaborate, and the link will be circulated to attendees prior to the event. The full consultation document can be found here, and it may be useful for you to read these frequently asked questions which are based on feedback we have already received. The forum will be structured around the issues raised in these FAQs, but we are happy to discuss any other questions or concerns you may have.
If you are unable to attend the forum, please leave your feedback here, or email fiona.chislett@sheffield.ac.uk.
description.html:
UKRI is currently consulting on the future development of its open access policy, including the inclusion of monographs, edited collections and book chapters into the policy scope. The changes under consultation will affect all UKRI funded researchers. Particular areas that may be of interest are: funding for open access books, licensing requirements and embargo periods.

We invite researchers at all levels (including PGRs) to discuss the consultation, ask questions and provide feedback at an online forum. The feedback you provide will shape our institutional response to UKRI. 

The forum will be held via Blackboard Collaborate, and the link will be circulated to attendees prior to the event. The full consultation document can be found here, and it may be useful for you to read these frequently asked questions which are based on feedback we have already received. The forum will be structured around the issues raised in these FAQs, but we are happy to discuss any other questions or concerns you may have.

If you are unable to attend the forum, please leave your feedback here, or email fiona.chislett@sheffield.ac.uk.

name.text: Our rights as authors and responsibilities as researchers

description.text:
"Our rights as authors and responsibilities as researchers"
This event will include talks from leading figures in the move towards responsible metrics and increasing authors' rights, as well as a panel discussion with contributions from across the University.
***Full details to follow***

description.text:
Is your data a bit messy?
Can't find that all-important file?
Looking for a better way to structure your data but not sure where to start?

Come along to this Bring Your Own Data workshop in Love Data Week and get hands-on support and advice to get your data in order. 
The session will start with some brief introductions to best practice in managing and analysing your data from experts in the Library and CiCS. We will then spend most of the time working with you to organise and structure your data - so make sure you bring some data with you!
description.html:

frontmatter.title: Urban Observatories hackathon
frontmatter.description: The University of Sheffield hosted a three-day hackathon aimed to begin tackling the complex challenges involved in coordinating analytics using data from urban observatories across the UK.
